fields.summary: 500 error when viewing tags - AttributeError: 'NoneType' object has no attribute 'get_absolute_url'
lasso_server.py treat nonexistent users as WARN in log
I went to ask a question, and it made me create an account.  When I verified the account, my question was lost.

fields.description:
When I ask a question Answers displays a set of possible matches but I cannot open an answer in a new tab, the list rolls up and disappears.  The ability to even follow the link in the current tab fails at some times.

The question titles are often imprecise so aren't really enough to pick a matching previous answer.   Maybe some kind of rollover would be the way to go?
fields.summary: "Ask a question" page doesn't allow me to follow links to existing questions
Undoing an up-vote results in 'unknown error'
Filter views for Atlassian involvement based on KaaP requirements

fields.description:
I recently updated my email notifications, and immediately started receiving email notifications about test questions on the answers-development.atlassian.com domain.

For example, I was linked to https://answers-development.atlassian.com/questions/1618/obligatory-follow-up-normal-question

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Copying an image from an existing Confluence page or from an existing answer/question into an answer or a new question, will cause a system error


h3. Steps to reproduce:
We have 2 scenarios for this problem

h4. New Question
# Create a Confluence page
# Make sure to add an image into that page
# Save the page
# Select the text and image and copy
# Go to Confluence Questions and *Ask a new Question*
# Enter the question title
# In the description, Paste the text and image copied earlier
# Save the question

h5. Expected Result
The question should be saved with the correct text and image in the description

h5. Actual Result

# Select the text and image and copy

# Save the answer

The answer should be saved with the correct text and image in the description

The only available workaround at the moment, is to paste the text first, then attach the images to the answer or to the question (depends on the scenario described above)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-46923].
  {panel}

h2. Problem Summary
Users are able to edit any Space Questions as long as they have View permissions for that space. This includes questions asked by other users. Users do not need to have Space Admin or even Add/Edit Page permissions to the space, only View is required.

This is inconsistent when compared to global questions (not tied to any specific space) which require either Confluence Administrator permissions or specific permissions granted based on CQ points levels. (Source: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/QUESTIONS/Permissions)

h2. Steps to reproduce
# Environment: Tested with Confluence 5.7.1 + Confluence Questions 2.1.3.
# Create a question in a Space
# Log in as a different user with only View permissions to that space, and navigate to the question

h2. Expected behavior
The user will be able to view, but not modify, the question

h2. Actual behavior
The Edit option will be present, and functional, for this user
fields.summary: Users with only View Space permission are able to edit Space Questions

fields.description:
h3. Step to reproduce:
# Install Confluence question plugin with the Confluence question French Language pack.
# Create a new user and set his default language to French via profile setting
# Create a new space and create a new question. 
# Go the question page via the space side bar. 

h3. Expected behaviour
The text in the search bar should be "Que voulez-vous savoir à propos de <space name>", as set in the language pack from the file "confluence-questions_fr_FR.properties" :
{code}
cq.searchbox.input.placeholder.space=Que voulez-vous savoir \u00E0 propos de {0}?
{code}
 !Screen Shot 2017-01-10 at 22.15.20.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual behaviour
The text in the search bar is showing "Que voulais vous savoir à propos de <space name>" as set in the default  translation mapping of the Confluence question plugin.
{code}
cq.searchbox.input.placeholder.space=Que voulais vous savoir \u00E0 propos de {0}?
{code}
which is a wrong translation of the sentence.

h3. Workaround
{panel:borderStyle=dashed| borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA}
(!) *PLEASE READ*: As with all recommendations made by Atlassian Support, please follow best practices for Change Management and *test and validate* these settings in a Test/Development and Staging environment *prior to* rolling any changes into a Production environment. This is to validate these changes and ensure that they will function well within your infrastructure prior to placing these changes in production.
{panel}

For Confluence Questions 2.6.11:
# Download [^confluence-questions-2.6.11.obr] (fixed version attached here)
# Navigate to !https://confluence.atlassian.com/download/attachments/590259974/Cog.png! > *Add-ons*
# Click *Upload add-on* 
# Upload the new obr downloaded in step 1
